comment: It feels like it needed more polish. The core is interesting, but the frustration wins.
Solid overall with a few rough edges. Fun core loop, but the pacing drags in the middle.
Fun, polished, and memorable. Not perfect, but it kept pulling me back in.
Not for me. The controls felt off and I spent more time fighting the interface than enjoying the game.
Not for me. The controls felt off and I spent more time fighting the interface than enjoying the game.
Solid overall with a few rough edges. Fun core loop, but the pacing drags in the middle.
I dropped it. The core loop didn’t hook me and the rough parts weren’t worth pushing through.
Wanted to love it, but the difficulty spikes feel random and the game punishes experimentation.
Surprisingly addictive. The pacing is good and the systems have more depth than they look at first.
The learning curve is real, but once it clicks it’s super rewarding. I love how it lets you solve problems your own way.
Not terrible, just not for me. Too many little annoyances kept pulling me out.
Surprisingly addictive. The pacing is good and the systems have more depth than they look at first.
Surprisingly addictive. The pacing is good and the systems have more depth than they look at first.
Instant classic for me. Tight mechanics, great pacing, and it kept surprising me with new ideas. I finished it and immediately wanted to start over.
It feels like it needed more polish. The core is interesting, but the frustration wins.
Not terrible, just not for me. Too many little annoyances kept pulling me out.
Perfect comfort game. So relaxing. The kind of thing you boot up to unwind and suddenly an hour disappears.
One of those games that sticks in your head when you’re not playing. Great vibes, great payoff, and it respects your time.
